data.text:
Barcelona for yourself

You are tempted to visit Barcelona, â€‹â€‹the famous Catalan resort, abounding rich architecture, a number of monuments, of interest, but also shops, restaurants and bars? I can tell you that you are in the right place as my guide has all the important information, advice and tips you need to know before traveling to Barcelona.

Video Barcelona GO! od Rob Whitworth.

Do you believe in love at first sight?

I personally love Barcelona â€” I've been to this Spanish city maybe 10 times and during each visit I've been fascinated or surprised by something. And it will certainly be no different for you.

This is it â€“ Barcelona's most famous monument, La Sagrada Familia

Barcelona is the capital of the autonomous community Catalonia, one of the many regions of Spain. Sunny here weather beckons to admire the beauty of the sea and beach comfort on Costa Brava. However, historic Barcelona offers much more than just a typical seaside holiday.

What you often ask me:

What is the weather like in Barcelona throughout the year?

What are the best sights and must-sees in Barcelona?

How to get from the airport to the center a how to travel around the city?

Where can I download the city map?

What accommodation options does Barcelona offer?

This European metropolis abounds in many beauties and carries, among other things, the legacy of one of the greatest artists of his time - genius architect Antoni GaudÃ­. In Barcelona you can admire right away several of his original buildings, which take you out of reality for a while and let you be carried away into the realm of symbols and dreams. Apart from them, you will find many others here monuments, sunny harbour, cable cars, palaces, shopping classes i traditional quarter, a number of romantic restaurants, good food, drink and all this wrapped up in an amazing experience that will take you away from all the worries of everyday life.

Whether you are coming here for an unusual vacation, a sightseeing tour or prolonged weekend, you can be sure that this city will not disappoint you. You can go to Barcelona by yourself or with children, there are enough attractions for them too.

You can find all the basic information in my guide to Barcelona, â€‹â€‹so you don't need to buy expensive printed books, which are also often out of date.

On the following pages I will advise you, the best way to get to Barcelona what means of transport to use when traveling around town, where to stay, where to go for a meal and of course what kind sights and places worth seeing.

View of Barcelona and its beaches from the plane

I always try to keep the information on this website as up-to-date as possible - for several years now I have been going to Barcelona every year with iron regularity for at least a few days.

City and travel cards - save on transport around the city and get free entrances to museums, monuments and interesting discounts in shops and restaurants.

Book tickets online - save money, time and nerves and buy tickets to monuments from the comfort of your home at the e-shop of the Barcelona Tourist Office; if you haven't bought tickets online yet, read mine detailed instructions along with my experience, how to do it.

Search for accommodation - plenty of hotels, hostels or guesthouses at reasonable prices. You can book immediately and pay after your stay.

Car rental - if you don't want to walk or if you want to go somewhere further from Barcelona, â€‹â€‹try Rental Cars. The car will be delivered at the airport and you don't have to worry about anything.
